trans-unit.source: Represents a text box control that can be hosted in a <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell"></xref>.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxEditingControl> class is a specialized type of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox> control that implements the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IDataGridViewEditingControl> interface, allowing it to be hosted in a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell> when the cell is in edit mode.
Handle the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditingControlShowing> event to perform custom initialization of the editing control when a cell enters edit mode.

To customize the display characteristics of the control, set the properties of the object returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditingControlShowingEventArgs.CellStyle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property rather than setting the properties of the control returned by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewEditingControlShowingEventArgs.Control%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxEditingControl"></xref> class.
This default constructor sets the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.Control.TabStop%2A> property to `false`.

Application code typically won't explicitly create instances of this class, because this is performed automatically when the containing <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn> is created.
Changes the control's user interface (UI) to be consistent with the specified cell style.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle"></xref> to use as the model for the UI.
Gets or sets the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that contains the text box control.

This property is automatically set when a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxColumn> or <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell> is created within a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView> or added to a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView>.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> that contains the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxCell"></xref> that contains this control; otherwise, `null` if there is no associated <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref>.
Gets or sets the formatted representation of the current value of the text box control.
The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.TextBox.Text%2A> property contains the actual data contained by the control.
The data is the string shown in the text box of the control.
In contrast, the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.IDataGridViewEditingControl.EditingControlFormattedValue%2A> property is the formatted representation of this string.
Since a text box uses plain text strings, these two properties are essentially the same.
An object representing the current value of this control.
Gets or sets the index of the owning cell's parent row.
The row index for the column headers row is -1.
The row index for a shared row is also -1.
The index of the row that contains the owning cell; -1 if there is no owning row.
Gets or sets a value indicating whether the current value of the text box control has changed.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewTextBoxEditingControl.EditingControlValueChanged%2A> property is set to `true` to indicate that the owning cell's value has changed, and the cell may need to be updated to reflect this change in value.
The owning cell or table will reset this property to `false` after it has updated itself.
When the control is initialized, this property is set to `false`.
`true` if the value of the control has changed; otherwise, `false`.
Determines whether the specified key is a regular input key that the editing control should process or a special key that the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> should process.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Keys"></xref> that represents the key that was pressed.
`true` when the wants to process the keyData; otherwise, `false`.
`true` if the specified key is a regular input key that should be handled by the editing control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets the cursor used when the mouse pointer is over the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView.EditingPanel"></xref> but not over the editing control.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Cursor"></xref> that represents the mouse pointer used for the editing panel.
Retrieves the formatted value of the cell.
One of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewDataErrorContexts"></xref> values that specifies the data error context.
An <xref href="System.Object"></xref> that represents the formatted version of the cell contents.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.MouseWheel"></xref> event.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.MouseEventArgs"></xref> that contains the event data.
Raises the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control.TextChanged"></xref> event and notifies the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridView"></xref> of the text change.
The event data.
Prepares the currently selected cell for editing.
`true` to select the cell contents; otherwise, `false`.
Processes key events.
This method ensures that the ENTER key is ignored so that carriage return and line feeds aren't stored in the cell value.
This method also allows the cell contents to be selected when CTRL+A is pressed.
A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Message"></xref> indicating the key that was pressed.
`true` if the key event was handled by the editing control; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the cell contents need to be repositioned whenever the value changes.

`true` if the cell's <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewCellStyle.WrapMode"></xref> is set to `true` and the alignment property is not set to one of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DataGridViewContentAlignment"></xref> values that aligns the content to the top; otherwise, `false`.
